content: Building a new home or renovating an existing one can be a thrilling experience for homeowners. However, the construction process can also be challenging, especially when it comes to understanding the legal terms and conditions in the building contract. One of the most critical stages of a construction project is Practical Completion, as it marks the end of the construction phase and the start of the handover process. Understanding what Practical Completion means, when it is achieved, and the associated legal obligations and risks is essential for homeowners under the HIA Contract. In this guide, we will provide a comprehensive overview of Practical Completion under the HIA Contract, including the definition of Practical Completion, the difference between Practical Completion and Final Completion, the timeframe for achieving Practical Completion, and the legal implications of receiving a Notice of Practical Completion under Clause 21 of the HIA Contract.
